conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible interior volume, and an angled/isometric-like camera with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and room volume; clean cutaway. Minor simplification of some wall cap/top-face treatment and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout broadly matches (large living area, kitchen zone, central hall, garage block, master suite zone). Some exterior/edge conditions (covered patios/nook geometry) appear simplified/omitted, and several partitions/openings do not precisely match the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Only minimal interior elements are modeled (notably kitchen cabinetry/counter). Bedrooms/baths lack key fixtures/furniture expected from the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable model with consistent materials and good visibility; no label/UI clutter. Some openings/door details are visually generic.

detected_errors.description: Several plan-specific boundary features (e.g., covered patio areas and some nook/exterior shaping) appear simplified or missing, reducing strict layout fidelity.
Door/window placement and sizing are partially generic; multiple openings do not clearly correspond to the exact walls/locations shown in the 2D plan.
Furniture/fixtures are largely absent (bath fixtures, bedroom furniture, living/dining items), limiting verification of room identity and scale.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway with strong volumetric conversion, but only moderate plan-accuracy and very sparse interior elements/opening fidelity.
